description: First floor rear extension and creation of additional storey (second floor level) to existing B1 building; with associated car parking provision, cycle and refuse storage.
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
REASON: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following drawing(s) and document(s): Proposed Ground Floor Plan, Drawing Number 1105-10, dated June 2016; Proposed First Floor Plan, Drawing Number 1105-11, dated June 2016; Proposed Second Floor Plan, Drawing Number 1105-12, dated March 2017; Proposed Roof Plan, Drawing Number 1105-13, dated March 2017; Proposed Section B, Drawing Number 1105-14, dated June 2016; Proposed Section A, Drawing Number 1105-15, dated June 2016; Proposed South (Front) Elevation, Drawing Number 1105-16, dated June 2016; Proposed West Elevation, Drawing Number 1105-17, dated June 2016; Proposed North Elevation, Drawing Number 1105-18, dated June 2016; Proposed East Elevation, Drawing Number 1105-19, dated June 2016; Cover letter, dated 30/03/2017; Car and Cycle Parking Site Plan, Drawing Number 1105-20, Revision B, dated March 2017
REASON: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall be as described on the approved plans and the submitted planning application form.

REASON: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings in accordance with policy 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD 2013, policy 1.1(h), and 1.2(g) of the Local Development Framework (Core Strategy 2012) and policy 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan 2016.

| Notwithstanding the provisions of Schedule 2, Part 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 2015 (or any other order revoking and re-enacting that order, with or without modifications), no works or changes of use shall be carried out without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained through the submission of a planning application.

REASON: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site and to safeguard the living conditions of occupiers of adjoining properties and the appearance of the street scene, in accordance with policies 1.1 (g) and (h) of the Adopted Development (Core) Strategy, and policies 7.4 and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016) and policies Ealing Local Variation of London Plan Policy 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan.

| The development hereby approved shall not be occupied until refuse and recycling storage, in accordance with approved plan Car and Cycle Parking Site Plan, Drawing Number 1105-20, Revision B, dated March 2017 and in accordance with the Local Planning Authority Standards, has been provided in the curtilage of the proposed building and has been fully implemented and made available for use. These facilities shall thereafter be retained for use at all times.

REASON: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD  (2013) and policies 7.4, and 7.6 of the London Plan (2016).

| Cycle storage for a minimum of four (4) bicycles shall be provided onsite in accordance with approved plan Car and Cycle Parking Site Plan, Drawing Number 1105-20, Revision B, dated March 2017, and all adopted standards prior to occupation of the building and be continuously available and retained for the life of the development hereby approved.
REASON: To provide adequate bicycle storage to align with Sustainable Transport SPG and policy 6.9 and 6.13 of the London Plan (2016).

| The rating noise level emitted from plant and machinery and/or noisy activities at the proposed development, as assessed under BS4142: 1997, shall be lower than the existing background noise level by at least 5 dBA as measured at 3.5 m from the nearest ground floor sensitive facade and 1m from upper floor noise sensitive facades, during the relevant periods of operation.

REASON:  To protect amenity of the area in accordance with policies with policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management Plan 2013, policy 1.1(e) of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy and The London Plan (2015) policy 7.15.
